message: I've created my first plugin. It's for accessing SimpleNote directly from vim and available here: https://github.com/mrtazz/simplenote.vim. Would love to get some feedback.
@mrtazz looks interesting. added a couple of issues and hope to play around with it some more later
interesting-- this is the first viable linux interface that i know about. i'll check it out!
@rdpate thanks for adding the issues. The changes are definitely getting in.

this is very interesting.  i just wish i didn't have to put my password in my .vimrc, since i might forget it's there if i want to share it with someone. any recommendations for a workaround? i guess i can just set it from command mode when i want to access my notes.
@katylava you can put the user & pass in a separate file and :source it in your vimrc
@mrtazz have you thought about using .netrc instead of putting the auth info in .vimrc? http://docs.python.org/library/netrc.html
@katylava I have also set it up in a different file and source it from my vimrc

@rdpate haven't thought about it, yet. Might be a good idea. I think the current approach (maybe with sourcing a file in vimrc) is pretty straight forward, though. But I'm also thinking about prompting the user for credentials if none are set on first issue of a :Simplenote command
@rdpate ah, yes, i will do that instead. thank you.
@mrtazz: simplenote.vim line 236: "map(lambda x: str(x), ..." is the same as "map(str, ..."
would be useful to display any set tags in the list, something like "Title (tag-a tag-b) [key]" perhaps
umm, that line 236 is on release/v0.1.0, btw :}
thoughts?
@mrtazz: here's that modified title display: https://github.com/rdpate/simplenote.vim/commit/a98b8cb4a0ac81b6b16a137d192aaf4b86a3f244
I was thinking trashed notes should be hidden by default with some kind of (runtime) option to show them
@katylava sourcing the auth variables is now also explained in the README in the development branch https://github.com/mrtazz/simplenote.vim/tree/develop
I made a couple more commits in that feature branch, but I'm incredibly new to git (much more comfortable with hg), so tell me if I'm doing something wrong

@rdpate Title formatting looks good! I'm unsure about whether trashed notes should be displayed at all or at the bottom. Tags and modified date should definitely get in and I really like the top display of pinned notes. One of the next thing I'll work on is removing the need for displaying the note ID which will free a lot of space for the title.
Oh, and good point about the lambda :)
I put the trashed prefix in there as a stopgap
display_limit in note_title doesn't have to be hardcoded, but making it user configurable isn't the right thing either

@rdpate I quickly looked at it earlier, but it seems the feature branch is missing on github now. But it looked good over all. I also think by default trashed notes should definitely not be displayed and maybe something like "g:SimplenoteShowTrashed = 1"  set will display them.
yeah, I screwed up my repo and I'm trying to fix it; it's not lost, just let me screw around with it for a sec :(
maybe once you work out how to hide the note IDs, the note title width could be dynamic based on current buffer width, and even possibly the length of the tag indicator for that note
I similarly didn't document the option because I figure that should be cleaned up a bit first
@mrtazz https://github.com/rdpate/simplenote.vim/commit/a4c7d42c1d0c203f879605a9fae1a64dbf5b28f8
git feels so awkward
my addition of g:SimplenoteShowTrashed feels very hacky, but I know very, very little VimL and this appears to work correctly
@rdpate in the development branch, there is no need to display the note key in the list anymore. It would be great if you could rebase your display mod on top of it.
